Database Architecture
An early proposal for a standard terminology and general
architecture database a system was produced in 1971 by
the Data Base Task Group (DBTG) appointed by the
Conference on data systems and languages.
The DBTG recognized the need for a two level approach
with a system view called the schema and user called
subschema.
The American National Standard Institute terminology
and architecture in 1975. ANSI-SPARC recognized the
need for a three level approach with a system catalog.
